title: About
description: Independent Wellington artist Jane Perry is known for her elegant, graphic and lively work.
She has an eclectic attitude to her subject : a mood, music, politics, memories or conversation. Her understanding of composition is unmistakeable.
She explores the subtleties of form and colour and clearly gets pleasure conveying this to others.

timeline.description: Attended Byam Shaw School of Painting and Drawing, London.
Trained at St. Albans School of Art as an art therapist.

Worked as a free-lance textile designer selling to Libertys, and Heals of London.
Has work registered at the Victoria and Albert Museum.
Illustrated  'New Zealand Whisky Book' by Stuart Perry (Collins).

Illustrated  'Taupo Fishing Diary' by Alex Gillett and Jane Perry ( Hodder and Stoughton).
Tourism Award.
Worked as an illustrator and display artist, National Museum of New Zealand.
Joint illustrator of  'Guide to Mammals of New Zealand' (Collins).

Began working as a full-time self-supporting painter and held annual exhibitions at Turnbull House, Wellington.
Biennial shows during International Festivals of the Arts.

Contributing illustrator of  'Painted Histories' by Roger Neich (AUP).
Finalist in Montana Book Awards.

Going Solo Exhibition, New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts.
Finalist, Telecom Art  Awards.
Group show of four Wellington artists at New Zealand Portrait Gallery.

Sold mainly direct from her studio.
Has work in collections in New Zealand and around the world.
